result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald R Tidyman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is entitled to 3 days credit IF revoked.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.
shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.

miscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.
Shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.

Defendant shall undergo and follow through with any counseling and/or treatment as recommended by Agent.
Sign all releases authorizing treatment provider to contact any and all collateral sources including CCAP information, and such other releases as requested by agent.
Treatment provider to report progress or lack thereof including lack of adequate effort or engagement to agent and, if requested by Court, to the Court. 
Treatment provider to provide at least quarterly progress reports to agent and if, requested by Court, to the Court.
Defendant shall comply with and successfully complete Impaired Driving Court (IDC).

timeConds.notes: in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence on or before 7/8/22 by 6:00 p.m.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald R Tidyman

Probation Intake Order

2:03 PM Defendant Gerald R Tidyman in court.  Attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Alyssa F. George in court for Gerald R Tidyman. Def. will plead today; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court reviews charge/penalties; Def. pleads Guilty to OWI4th; Court reviews recomm.; stip. to facts; Court finds plea made FV&I and finds Def. guilty of OWI4th; State heard; BAC .197; Atty. George heard; Court imposes sentence; report to P&P by 4pm by Friday

**W/H - 24 mo. PO - 3 days credit if revoked
- 29 days in DCJ w/H&Tr. to comm. on or before 7/8/22
- $1200 F+C = $2,347 w/in 60 days
- $250 DNA surcharge/sample
- $26 blood draw fee
- AODA & FT
- treatment providers to provide progress reports to Agent and/or court if requested
- sign releases, etc.
- absolute sobriety, no bars
- not operate a MV w/o valid DL
- comply with and successfully complete IDC

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license. Must have Ignition Interlock device installed on any vehicle owned or operated by Defendant.

11:25 AM Defendant Gerald R Tidyman in court.  Attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Alyssa F. George in court for Gerald R Tidyman. This is Def.'s bail motion; Atty. George heard on same, requests no driving be modified to not drive w/o valid DL; State opposes same; Atty. George response; Court heard and amends bond to Operate w/o Valid DL and must be equipped with IID device on any vehicle owned or operated by Def.; TSC set 6/7/22 at 8:45 am

records.addlTxt:
9:16 AM Prosecuting attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gerald R Tidyman in court.  Attorney Alyssa F. George in court for Gerald R Tidyman. State calls Sgt Russell Ebert, sworn & testifies; witness ID's def; Court finds prob cause;
Arraignment scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Arraignment on April 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.

01:04 PM Defendant Gerald R Tidyman in court, in custody with attorney Jacob Van Kerkvoorde (eligible).  Jin Ho D. Pack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Gerald R Tidyman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
